pageContext.claim: “Do you remember during the debate I said Hillary Clinton was willing to rip the baby out of the womb just prior to birth? And I used the term ‘rip’? That’s what it is [in the Virginia bill]. That’s what they're doing, it’s terrible.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an exaggeration. The Virginia bill primarily does three things. It reduces the number of doctors required to agree that "the continuation of the pregnancy is likely to result in the death of the woman" or "impair the mental or physical health of the woman" from three to one. It removes the waiting period. And it would broaden the number of situations where abortion would be allowed by removing the phrase "substantially and irremediably" from a section describing the necessary circumstances. Plus, the applies to a small subset of cases — 1.4 percent of abortions happen after 21 weeks.
